reason: While Restaurant A offers a significantly higher quality rating (90 vs. 45) and a premium dining experience, its menu does not align well with my Chinese cuisine preference or my gluten intolerance and low sodium dietary needs. The menu items at Restaurant A are primarily French and Italian-inspired dishes, which are less likely to accommodate gluten-free and low sodium requirements without significant modifications. In contrast, Restaurant B, although lower in quality rating, offers Chinese cuisine options such as Peking Duck, Kung Pao Chicken, and Lobster Pad Thai that better match my food preferences. Given my middle-class budget of $8K-11.9K and the same average meal price of $88.1 at both restaurants, affordability is not a deciding factor. However, the creative personality I have values a dining experience that feels authentic and culturally relevant, which Restaurant B provides through its casual, comfort food atmosphere. Despite the lower quality rating, Restaurant B's menu and vibe better suit my dietary restrictions and creative food interests, making it the more suitable choice.
